meanings.definition: The act or process of making exact copies of documents or images using photography.
meanings.sent1: The photoduplications of the old family photos were displayed proudly on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The office had a machine dedicated to creating photoduplications of important paperwork.
meanings.sent3: The detective's photoduplications of the evidence helped solve the mysterious case.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a series of photoduplications, each one capturing a different moment in time.
meanings.sent5: The artist's photoduplications of nature were so realistic, they looked like actual photographs.

meanings.definition: Copies made through the process of photoduplication.
meanings.sent1: The library had a section dedicated to storing photoduplications of rare manuscripts.
meanings.sent2: The historian compared the original document to the photoduplications for accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The photoduplications of the painting were so good, they fooled even the experts.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a collection of photoduplications, each one representing a different idea.
meanings.sent5: The photoduplications of the map were essential for navigation in the uncharted territory.
